term.title: radiation trapping

item.text: Process by which the resonance radiation emitted in a lamp is absorbed and re-emitted many times in the plasma prior to striking the phosphor. This process is called radiation trapping or imprisonment.

notes.item: Radiation trapping lengthens the effective lifetime of emission as viewed from outside the lamp. The control of this trapping is, therefore, an important design consideration for low-pressure lamps.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 410 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
